interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Face of Love
Review Date: 2015/09/29
Store: Annette Bening  (Actor),     Ed Harris  (Actor),     Arie Posin  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
Product Description: ["Five years after the death of her beloved husband Garrett (Ed Harris), Nikki (Annette Bening) meets Tom, a man who seems to be Garrett's exact duplicate. Not only does Tom possess the same physical characteristics, but he also shares Garrett's kindness, humor, and passion for art. And yet he is a stranger. As romance blossoms between Nikki and Tom, she finds she can't bring herself to tell him the truth about what drew her to him. But as their relationship progresses, it becomes not a question of if the truth will come out, but when. Director Arie Posin's (THE CHUMSCRUBBER) THE FACE OF LOVE is an emotionally thorny drama about how we cope with loss, live in the moment and ultimately move forward."]
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Color, Widescreen, NTSC, Multiple Formats', 'Contributor': 'Annette Bening, Arie Posin, Ed Harris, Robin Williams', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 31 minutes', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'IDFC9373DVD', 'Director': 'Arie Posin', 'Media Format': 'Color, Widescreen, NTSC, Multiple Formats', 'Run time': '1 hour and 31 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 15, 2014', 'Actors': 'Annette Bening, Ed Harris, Robin Williams', 'Studio': 'IFC Independent Film', 'Number of discs': '1'}

Review Title: Five Stars

['Something To Talk About (DVD)', "She has everything a young, Southern married woman could want: wealth, stability, strong family roots--until the day she sees her husband kissing another woman. ["A thrilling behind the scenes look at the creation of Raf Simons' highly anticipated first Haute Couture collection as the iconic brand's new Artistic Director. Beautifully melding the everyday, pressure- filled components of fashion with an elegant reverence for the history of Dior, director Frederic Tcheng's colorful homage is nothing short of magical."]

['Adaline (Blake Lively) ceases to age following an accident one icy night, but keeps her condition a closely-guarded secret while embarking on a number of incredible adventures throughout the 20th Century. After years of a solitary life, she finds the love and courage that enable her to fully begin living.']

A Little Chaos (DVD)
Kate Winslet  (Actor),     Matthias Schoenaerts  (Actor)    Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Comedy
["Academy Award®-winner Kate Winslet stars in this romantic drama as Sabine, a strong-willed and talented landscape designer, who is chosen to build one of the main gardens at the new palace at Versailles in the court of King Louis XIV (Alan Rickman). In her new position of power, she challenges gender and class barriers while also becoming professionally and romantically entangled with the court's renowned landscape artist André Le Notre (Matthias Schoenaerts).", ']]>']

Far From the Madding Crowd
Matthias Schoenaerts  (Actor),     Mark Wingett  (Actor),     Thomas Vinterberg  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
['Carey Mulligan stars as a headstrong Victorian beauty in this sweeping romantic drama, based on the literary classic by Thomas Hardy. Mulligan plays Bathsheba Everdene, an independent woman who attracts three different suitors: a sheep farmer (Matthias Schoenaerts); a dashing soldier (Tom Sturridge); and a prosperous, older bachelor (Michael Sheen). This timeless story of Bathsheba s passions explores the nature of relationships, love and resilience. Bonus Features:**Theatrical Feature**Promotional Feturettes**Gallery**Theatrical Trailer']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Movie Preferences:** The user remains committed to drama films with strong narratives and character-driven plots, continuing to express a fondness for romantic comedies that highlight love and determination. Their appreciation for classic romantic dramas has grown, particularly those featuring strong female leads, further complemented by a recent interest in films addressing themes of loss and emotional resilience.

- **Actors & Directors:** Their selections prominently feature well-known actors, with the addition of Annette Bening reflecting a broader interest in talented performers. Existing favorites include Kate Winslet, Dennis Quaid, Harrison Ford, Alan Rickman, and Carey Mulligan. The user gravitates towards films directed by acclaimed industry talents, showcasing a preference for quality storytelling.

- **Themes & Interests:** The user's thematic focus persists on personal empowerment and emotional journeys, now enriched by explorations of resilience in relationships and coping with loss. They maintain an interest in equestrian elements and engage with issues related to workplace challenges and gender equity.

- **Review Style:** Reviews consistently showcase their enthusiastic engagement, characterized by high ratings and detailed praise. The latest review exemplifies their appreciation for impactful storytelling.

- **Content Format:** The user continues to prefer physical media, specifically DVDs, reflecting a nostalgic viewing experience while embracing a commitment to meaningful storytelling across diverse genres.

Overall, this user exhibits a deep passion for storytelling, coupled with a discerning eye for quality performances and an evolving interest in romantic and dramatic narratives.
